ground_truth: They both look over at Darcy, who glowers before striding away. Lydia and Kitty drag Denny and the other officer away. Lizzie looks puzzled and a little disappointed, but her bad humor disappears when she spies Charlotte across the room. She hurries over to her happily. Mr. Collins, all in black, prances over to the lady next to Lizzie. He holds out a hand to Lizzie, who reluctantly takes it, and they cross the floor to join the dance. They curtsey and bow, circle each other. Then, he returns to the line of men. As Lizzie dances, Mr. Collins leers at her, then, normally, makes to follow her in the dance. Darcy is watching with amusement. Lizzie sees him looking and glares. Darcy's face drops and then returns to his usual stern composure. He slowly walks around the dancers passing Mrs. Bennet deep in conversation. He watches Jane and Bingley performing the intricate moves of the dance. As they cross each other, briefly holding each other's outstretched hands, Darcy seems to take more of an interest in them. He looks contemptuously at Lydia dancing with gay abandon with the officers. Darcy turns back on himself stopping by flickering candles, his eyes once more drawn back to Lizzie, skipping in a circle with her dance set, her dark hair swinging like a ponytail. Darcy's gaze is steady, his high white shirt collar and dark coat frame his stern features. Another dance is taking place. Charlotte and Lizzie are talking. Darcy is standing before them. He bows. They curtsy in return. He bows once more and leaves. Lizzie resignedly leaves Charlotte's sight. With the men on one side of the floor and women on the other, Lizzie and Darcy stand opposite to each other looking serious. The men slowly bow and the dance begins. The gentlemen and the ladies grasp each other's hands, and circle one way, then the other. Lizzie and Darcy maintain steady eye-contact throughout. As they move away from each other, then double back to cross over, a slight smile is playing across Lizzie's lips. Darcy's face betrays no emotion. They form a straight line with another couple before releasing hands, turning and coming to a brief halt facing each other. The dance forces them away from each other. She sighs heavily raising her eyebrows. They circle each other holding hands. Darcy is still serious. The passing of the dance leads Lizzie away for a moment, then back again. They separate to allow a couple to move between them, then they return to being opposite to one another. Lizzie hides a look of amusement as the dance continues. The nine couples move in unison watched by other guests, a magnificent chandelier hanging over their heads.

Lizzie appears perplexed and a little disappointed, but her bad mood vanishes when she spots Charlotte across the space. She rushes over to her gladly. As they pass each other, briefly holding each other's outstretched hands, Darcy seems to take more of an interest in them. He glances disdainfully at Lydia dancing with gay abandon with the officers. Darcy turns back on himself halting by flickering candles, his eyes once more drawn back to Lizzie, skipping in a circle with her dance set, her dark hair swinging like a ponytail. Darcy's gaze is fixed, his high white shirt collar and dark coat frame his stern features. Another dance is occurring. Charlotte and Lizzie are conversing. Darcy is standing before them. He bows. They curtsy in return. He bows once more and departs. Lizzie resignedly leaves Charlotte's sight. With the men on one side of the floor and women on the other, Lizzie and Darcy stand opposite to each other looking serious. The men slowly bow and the dance commences. The gentlemen and the ladies clasp each other's hands, and circle one way, then the other. Lizzie and Darcy maintain steady eye-contact throughout. As they move away from each other, then double back to cross over, a slight smile is playing across Lizzie's lips. Darcy's face reveals no emotion. They form a straight line with another couple before releasing hands, turning and coming to a brief halt facing each other. The dance compels them away from each other. She sighs heavily raising her eyebrows. They circle each other holding hands. Darcy is still serious. The passing of the dance leads Lizzie away for a moment, then back again. They separate to allow a couple to move between them, then they return to being opposite to one another. Lizzie conceals a look of amusement as the dance continues. They are formed into a straight line with another couple before hands are released, turning and coming to a brief halt facing each other. Away from each other, they are forced by the dance. A heavy sigh is given by her, raising her eyebrows. Each other is circled by them holding hands. Seriousness is still maintained by Darcy. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Darcy glowers and strides away as Lydia and Kitty drag Denny and another officer off. Lizzie, puzzled and slightly disappointed, brightens upon seeing Charlotte and hurries over. Mr. Collins, in black, prances to Lizzie, offers his hand, and they join the dance. They curtsey, bow, and circle each other. Collins leers at Lizzie while Darcy watches amusedly. Lizzie glares at Darcy, who regains his stern composure. Darcy walks past Mrs. Bennet and observes Jane and Bingley dancing intricately. He looks disdainfully at Lydia dancing joyfully with officers. Darcy's attention returns to Lizzie, whose hair swings as she circles with her dance set. His steady gaze contrasts with his stern features. Another dance begins; Charlotte and Lizzie converse. Darcy bows; they curtsy in return before he leaves. Lizzie departs from Charlotte. Opposite Darcy, she looks serious as the dance begins. They maintain eye contact, and a slight smile plays on Lizzie’s lips, while Darcy remains emotionless. The dance separates and brings them back, with Lizzie hiding amusement among nine couples moving in unison under a magnificent chandelier.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Darcy glowers and leaves as Lydia and Kitty pull Denny and another officer away. Lizzie, puzzled but happier when spotting Charlotte, rushes to her. Mr. Collins, dressed in black, approaches and offers Lizzie his hand reluctantly. They join the dance, bowing and circling. Collins leers at Lizzie while Darcy watches amused. Lizzie glares at Darcy, who regains his stern composure, observing the dancers, particularly Jane and Bingley. He notices Lydia dancing with officers, then refocuses on Lizzie. As Darcy's gaze remains steady, another dance begins with Lizzie and Charlotte talking. Darcy bows before them, and they curtsy. Opposite on the dance floor, Lizzie and Darcy maintain eye contact, exchanging a slight smile from Lizzie as the dance progresses. They form a line with another couple, then separate, circling with hands held. Lizzie sighs, raising her brows. The dance temporarily separates them before reuniting, and Lizzie hides amusement. Nine couples move uniformly under the chandelier, observed by guests.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Both observers turn their attention toward Darcy, who responds with a dark, displeased look before striding away with purposeful steps. Meanwhile, Lydia and Kitty enthusiastically pull Denny and the other officer along with them, engaging in lively conversation as they move. Lizzie is left standing there, her expression a tapestry of confusion and a hint of disappointment. However, her mood brightens considerably when her eyes catch sight of Charlotte across the bustling room. With a joyful spirit, she makes her way over there. Mr. Collins, dressed entirely in black like a somber raven, prances forward to approach the lady standing next to Lizzie. With an air of pompous ceremony, he extends his hand toward Lizzie, who, albeit reluctantly, accepts it. Together, they traverse the dance floor to join the ongoing dance. They execute a series of curtseys and bows before elegantly circling around each other. Following this graceful exchange, Mr. Collins returns to his designated line among the men. As Lizzie dances, she feels Mr. Collins' eyes lingering on her. He leers awkwardly but continues to follow the rhythm of the dance. Observing from a distance, Darcy watches with a trace of amusement glinting in his eyes. Lizzie catches him watching and responds with a piercing glare. Darcy's expression falters momentarily before he regains his usual stern composure. He then proceeds to walk slowly around the dancers, eventually passing Mrs. Bennet, who is deeply engrossed in animated conversation. His gaze shifts to Jane and Bingley as they expertly perform the intricate steps of the dance. As they cross paths, briefly touching each other's outstretched hands, Darcy appears to show a heightened curiosity in their interaction. He casts a disdainful look at Lydia, who is dancing with carefree exuberance among the officers. Turning back on his path, Darcy stops briefly beside flickering candles, his attention once again drawn inexorably back to Lizzie. She is lively and spirited, skipping in a circle with her dance set, her dark hair swinging like a ponytail and capturing the light. His gaze remains steady, his high white shirt collar and dark coat serving to frame his stern, distinguished features. Another lively dance is taking place. Charlotte and Lizzie are seen engaged in animated conversation when Darcy approaches them. He bows respectfully, and they respond with curtsies in kind. After bowing once more, Darcy departs. Lizzie, with a resigned expression, moves away from Charlotte's side. As the dance progresses, the men position themselves on one side of the floor while the women stand on the other, with Lizzie and Darcy now standing opposite each other. Both wear serious expressions. The men bow slowly, signaling the beginning of the dance. Together, the gentlemen and the ladies clasp each other's hands, first circling in one direction and then reversing. Throughout this elaborate maneuver, Lizzie and Darcy maintain unwavering eye contact. As they move apart and then double back to cross paths once more, a subtle smile begins to form on Lizzie's lips. Darcy's face, meanwhile, remains a mask of impassivity. They join another couple to form a straight line before releasing hands, turning, and coming to a temporary halt to face one another. The dance dictates their movements, drawing them away from each other. Lizzie exhales a heavy sigh, raising her eyebrows in a gesture of mild exasperation. They circle each other again, holding hands with precision. Darcy's demeanor remains serious, undeterred by the flow of the dance. As the sequence of steps momentarily separates Lizzie from Darcy, she is then brought back within his proximity. They part to allow space for another couple to pass between them, then seamlessly return to their opposed stances. Lizzie conceals a look of amusement as the dance persists. The nine couples glide in perfect synchrony, their movements meticulously observed by the gathered guests, while an impressive chandelier casts a radiant glow overhead, encapsulating the grandeur of the moment.

In response, he casts a dark, displeased look in their direction before striding away with determined and purposeful steps. Lizzie, wearing a resigned expression, moves away from Charlotte's side. As the dance progresses, the men position themselves on one side of the floor while the women stand on the opposite side, with Lizzie and Darcy now standing face to face. Throughout this elaborate maneuver, Lizzie and Darcy maintain unwavering eye contact. As they move apart and then double back to cross paths once more, a subtle smile begins to form on Lizzie's lips. Meanwhile, Darcy's face remains a mask of impassivity. They join another couple to form a straight line, then release hands, turn, and come to a temporary halt to face one another. The dance dictates their movements, drawing them momentarily away from each other. Lizzie exhales a heavy sigh, raising her eyebrows in mild exasperation. They circle each other again, holding hands with precision and intention. Darcy's demeanor remains serious, undeterred by the flow of the dance. As the sequence of steps separates Lizzie from Darcy, she is then brought back within his proximity. They part to allow another couple to pass between them, seamlessly returning to their opposed stances. Lizzie conceals a look of amusement as the dance continues. test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: They both direct their gaze towards Darcy, who fixes them with a dark glower before confidently striding away without hesitation. Meanwhile, Lydia and Kitty energetically tug Denny and the other officer along with them, pulling them away to some undisclosed destination. In the midst of this, Lizzie stands there, her face a picture of puzzlement tinged with disappointment, yet this fleeting bad humor dissipates the moment her eyes land on Charlotte across the room. Instantly, she's filled with happiness and eagerly hurries over to her friend. The atmosphere shifts as Mr. Collins, clad entirely in black, makes an exaggerated prance over to the lady standing next to Lizzie. With a practiced flourish, he extends his hand to Lizzie, who with a hint of reluctance takes it, as they proceed to cross the floor with the intent of joining the dance. They execute a curtsey and a bow, gracefully circling each other in the dance's ritualistic movements. Soon after, Mr. Collins returns to his place among the line of men. As the dance continues, Lizzie moves fluidly, while Mr. Collins casts a leering glance at her, only to later follow more conventionally in the dance's steps. During this spectacle, Darcy observes from a distance, amusement playing on his features. Lizzie, noticing Darcy's watchful eyes, responds with a glare, causing Darcy's expression to briefly fall before he recomposes himself, reverting to his usual stern demeanor. He takes a slow, deliberate walk around the room's perimeter, passing by Mrs. Bennet who is deeply engrossed in a conversation. His attention shifts momentarily to Jane and Bingley, who are seamlessly performing the dance's intricate moves. As they cross paths, briefly clasping each other's outstretched hands, Darcy's interest piques, though he regards them with a reserved expression. His gaze then flicks contemptuously towards Lydia, who dances with carefree exuberance alongside the officers. He then retraces his steps, pausing by some flickering candles, only to have his eyes drawn once more to Lizzie, who is skipping in a circle with her dance set, her dark hair swinging like a ponytail with each turn. Darcy's stare is unwavering, his high white shirt collar and dark coat framing his stern visage. As another dance unfolds, Charlotte and Lizzie engage in conversation until Darcy positions himself before them. He offers a formal bow, prompting them to reciprocate with graceful curtsies. After another bow, he departs, leading Lizzie to leave Charlotte's side with a sense of resignation. Now, with the men aligned on one side of the floor and the women on the opposite, Lizzie and Darcy find themselves directly opposite each other, both bearing serious expressions. The men commence with a slow bow, signaling the dance's beginning. As the dance progresses, gentlemen and ladies clasp each other's hands, weaving through the dance floor, circling one way and then the other. Throughout, Lizzie and Darcy maintain an unbroken eye-contact, even as they part momentarily only to double back and cross paths once more, a faint smile curving Lizzie's lips while Darcy's face remains impassive. They form a straight line with another couple, then release hands, turn, and come to a brief halt while facing each other. The dance pattern draws them apart once more, prompting Lizzie to heave a heavy sigh accompanied by raised eyebrows. They continue to circle one another, hands intertwined, with Darcy maintaining his serious demeanor. The course of the dance briefly separates Lizzie from Darcy, only to bring them back together again. They part to allow another couple to pass between them, subsequently reuniting to stand opposite each other once more. Lizzie conceals a flicker of amusement as the dance carries on, with all nine couples moving in coordinated unison, observed by other guests under the grandeur of a magnificent chandelier hanging overhead.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Darcy glowers at Lydia and Kitty as they drag Denny and another officer away, then strides off. Lizzie, initially puzzled and disappointed, brightens upon seeing Charlotte and hurries over. Mr. Collins, dressed in black, prances over to Lizzie, and, after she reluctantly takes his hand, they join the dance, curtseying and bowing. Collins returns to the men's line, leering at Lizzie before following the dance. Darcy watches with amusement, but his expression turns stern when Lizzie glares at him. As he walks around the dancers, he observes Jane and Bingley's intricate dance, his interest piqued, while casting a contemptuous glance at Lydia's spirited dancing with the officers. Darcy pauses by flickering candles, drawn back to Lizzie, whose hair swings as she dances. Darcy maintains a steady gaze, framed by his high white collar and dark coat. As another dance begins, Charlotte and Lizzie converse until Darcy approaches, bowing formally. They curtsy in return, and he departs. Lizzie then stands opposite Darcy at the dance floor's center, both looking serious. The dance unfolds with steady eye contact between them, Lizzie smiling slightly while Darcy remains emotionless. They move together and apart, forming lines and circling with other couples. Despite the dance keeping them apart at times, Lizzie’s amusement grows, unnoticed by the stern Darcy. The nine couples dance in unison under a magnificent chandelier as hosted guests watch.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They both look over at Darcy, who glowers before striding away with the confident air of a man used to commanding attention in any room. Lydia and Kitty drag Denny, a young officer known for his charm and quick wit, and the other officer away. Lizzie looks puzzled and a little disappointed, but her bad humor disappears when she spies Charlotte, her devoted friend from childhood, across the room. She hurries over to her happily. Mr. Collins, all in black like a somber raven attending a garden party, prances over to the lady next to Lizzie. He holds out a hand to Lizzie, who reluctantly takes it, and they cross the floor to join the dance, a lively quadrille popular in 19th-century English society. They curtsey and bow, circle each other in the formal, practiced steps of the dance. Then, he returns to the line of men. As Lizzie dances, Mr. Collins, who is known for his awkward social presence, leers at her, then, normally, makes to follow her in the dance. Darcy, the wealthy master of Pemberley estate, is watching with amusement. Lizzie sees him looking and glares. Darcy's face drops and then returns to his usual stern composure, a mask he often wore in public. He slowly walks around the dancers passing Mrs. Bennet, who is deep in conversation about eligible bachelors for her daughters. He watches Jane, her serenity a contrast to the lively crowd, and Bingley performing the intricate moves of the dance. As they cross each other, briefly holding each other's outstretched hands, Darcy seems to take more of an interest in them, perhaps considering their potential match. He looks contemptuously at Lydia, known for her carefree spirit, dancing with gay abandon with the officers. Darcy turns back on himself stopping by flickering candles that cast a warm glow, his eyes once more drawn back to Lizzie, skipping in a circle with her dance set, her dark hair swinging like a ponytail. Darcy's gaze is steady, his high white shirt collar and dark coat frame his stern features, reminiscent of a proud and stoic English gentleman. Another dance is taking place. Charlotte and Lizzie are talking about the latest gossip and social matters. Darcy is standing before them. He bows with the grace of a practiced dancer. They curtsy in return. He bows once more and leaves. Lizzie resignedly leaves Charlotte's sight. With the men on one side of the floor and women on the other, reflecting the traditional segregation of dance partners, Lizzie and Darcy stand opposite to each other looking serious. The men slowly bow and the dance begins. The gentlemen and the ladies grasp each other's hands, and circle one way, then the other, in a coordinated and timed sequence. Lizzie and Darcy maintain steady eye-contact throughout, a silent communication shared in the midst of a crowded room. As they move away from each other, then double back to cross over, a slight smile is playing across Lizzie's lips, suggesting a newfound appreciation for the enigmatic man before her. Darcy's face betrays no emotion, his disciplined demeanor rarely slipping. They form a straight line with another couple before releasing hands, turning and coming to a brief halt facing each other. The dance forces them away from each other. She sighs heavily raising her eyebrows, a gesture of mingled exasperation and amusement. They circle each other holding hands, part of the dance's choreographed routine. Darcy is still serious, focusing intently on his partner. The passing of the dance leads Lizzie away for a moment, then back again, like a tide that recedes and returns. They separate to allow a couple to move between them, then they return to being opposite to one another. Lizzie hides a look of amusement as the dance continues. The nine couples move in unison watched by other guests, a magnificent chandelier, the centerpiece of the grand ballroom, hanging over their heads.

They separate to allow a couple to move between them. then they return to being opposite to one another. Lizzie hides a look of amusement as the dance continues. The nine couples move in unison watched by other guests a magnificent chandelier hanging over their heads.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: They both look over at Darcy who glowers before striding away. Lydia and Kitty drag Denny and the other officer away. Lizzie looks puzzled and a little disappointed but her bad humor disappears when she spies Charlotte across the room. She hurries over to her happily. Mr Collins all in black prances over to the lady next to Lizzie. He holds out a hand to Lizzie who reluctantly takes it and they cross the floor to join the dance. They curtsey and bow circle each other. Then he returns to the line of men. As Lizzie dances Mr Collins leers at her then normally makes to follow her in the dance. Darcy is watching with amusement. Lizzie sees him looking and glares. Darcy's face drops and then returns to his usual stern composure. He slowly walks around the dancers passing Mrs Bennet deep in conversation. He watches Jane and Bingley performing the intricate moves of the dance. As they cross each other briefly holding each other's outstretched hands Darcy seems to take more of an interest in them. He looks contemptuously at Lydia dancing with gay abandon with the officers. Darcy turns back on himself stopping by flickering candles his eyes once more drawn back to Lizzie skipping in a circle with her dance set her dark hair swinging like a ponytail. Darcy's gaze is steady. his high white shirt collar and dark coat frame his stern features. Another dance is taking place. Charlotte and Lizzie are talking. Darcy is standing before them. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. They curtsy in return. He bows once more and leaves. Lizzie resignedly leaves Charlotte's sight. With the men on one side of the floor and women on the other. Lizzie and Darcy stand opposite to each other looking serious. The men slowly bow and the dance begins. The gentlemen and the ladies grasp each other's hands and circle one way then the other. Lizzie and Darcy maintain steady eyecontact throughout. As they move away from each other then double back to cross over. a slight smile is playing across Lizzie's lips. Darcy's face betrays no emotion. They form a straight line with another couple before releasing hands turning and coming to a brief halt facing each other. The dance forces them away from each other. She sighs heavily raising her eyebrows. They circle each other holding hands. Darcy is still serious. The passing of the dance leads Lizzie away for a moment then back again. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffes both blink at Marcy, who giggles before galloping away. Leo and Ivan haul Benny and the entire librarian away. Izzy feels bewildered and slightly elated, but her annoyance vanishes when she spots Janet across the arena. She skips over to her joyfully. Mr. Watson, donning all pink, skips over to the sailor next to Izzy. He waves a stick to Izzy, who reluctantly grabs it, and they shuffle the yard to join the jump. They twirl and bend, dodge each other. Then, he prances back to the circle of clowns. As Izzy skips, Mr. Watson winks at her, then, awkwardly, tries to chase her in the jump. Marcy is observing with concern. Izzy sees her staring and snickers. Marcy's grin vanishes and then reverts to her typical blank expression. She swiftly hops around the players passing Mr. Bonnet lost in giggles. She observes Jean and Billy executing the elaborate actions of the jump. As they pass one another, barely grasping each other's waving sticks, Marcy seems to show more curiosity in them. She glances disdainfully at Leo twirling with wild delight with the librarians. Marcy spins back on herself halting by burning lanterns, her vision yet again pulled back to Izzy, twirling in a square with her jump group, her curly fur bouncing like a spring. Marcy's vision remains unflinching, her tall purple hat and bright sweater frame her vacant expression. Another hop is happening. Janet and Izzy are pondering. Marcy is standing before them. She nods. They nod in response. She nods again and disappears. Izzy reluctantly wanders out of Janet's range. With the clowns on one corner of the yard and sailors on the other, Izzy and Marcy stand parallel to one another appearing focused. The clowns gently nod and the jump starts. The clowns and the sailors hug each other's elbows, and twirl one side, then the other. Izzy and Marcy hold constant eye-contact throughout. As they bounce away from each other, then double back to leap over, a tiny grin is dancing across Izzy's lips. Marcy's face shows no reaction. They form an angular corner with another unit before releasing elbows, flipping and coming to a short pause facing one another. The jump propels them away from one another. She exhales deeply raising her eyelids. They twist around holding elbows. Marcy remains stoic. The passing of the leap guides Izzy away momentarily, then back again. They part to let a unit glide between them, then they revert to being parallel to one another. Izzy conceals a smirk of delight as the leap continues. The eight clowns move in harmony observed by other observers, a colossal torch hanging above their heads.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Darcy glowers and walks away as Lydia and Kitty lead the officers elsewhere. Lizzie appears puzzled but cheers up upon spotting Charlotte. Mr. Collins, dressed in black, invites Lizzie to dance, and they join the floor. As Lizzie dances, Mr. Collins leers, earning Darcy's amused attention. Lizzie notices Darcy watching and glares, causing his expression to change briefly. Darcy observes Jane and Bingley's dance with interest before returning his gaze to Lizzie. Lizzie and Charlotte converse until Darcy approaches, bows, and leaves. Lizzie resigns herself to dancing with Darcy. Opposite each other, Lizzie and Darcy maintain eye contact as they dance. Despite Darcy's stoic demeanor, Lizzie's lips hint at a smile. Their movements separate them momentarily, but they reunite, holding hands and circling each other. Lizzie conceals her amusement as they continue the dance, the scene illuminated by a grand chandelier.
